briefdescription.para: Successful status code.

detaileddescription.para: Function return ECCParams_STATUS_SUCCESS if the control code was executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Generic error status code.

detaileddescription.para: Functions return ECCParams_STATUS_ERROR if the control code was not executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Number of bytes for the length word prepended before all parameters passed into the ECC SW library functions.
Length of NIST P256 curve parameters in bytes.
Length in bytes of NISTP256 curve parameters including the prepended length word.
Length of NIST P224 curve parameters in bytes.
Length in bytes of NISTP256 curve parameters including the prepended length word.
Length of Curve25519 curve parameters in bytes.
Length in bytes of Curve25519 curve parameters including the prepended length word.
Enumeration of ECC curve names supported by TF-M.
Enumeration of curve equations supported.

detaileddescription.para: Elliptic curves can be expressed using multiple equations of polynomials over finite fields. All forms can be converted to one another using parameter substitution. Each curve has a default curve equations it was designed to use.

Some curve implementations have restrictions on which algorithms and schemes they work with. For example, Curve25519 was explicitely designed with ECDH in mind. It only uses and yields the X coordinate of a point on the elliptic curve in common implementations. Some implementations do provide X and Y affine coordinates but most do not. Therefore, ECDSA and ECJPAKE do not have compatible implementations for Curve25519 on some devices as the Y coordinate is required by them.
Check the header files of each device-specific implementation for information regarding curve-support for specific schemes on a device.

entry.para: y^2 = x^3 + a*x + b mod p
By^2 = x^3 + Ax^2 + x mod p

briefdescription.para: A structure containing the parameters of an elliptic curve.

detaileddescription.para: Elliptical Curve Cryptography (ECC) prime curve parameters.

briefdescription.para: The NISTP192 curve in short Weierstrass form.
The NISTP224 curve in short Weierstrass form.
The NISTP256 curve in short Weierstrass form.
The NISTP384 curve in short Weierstrass form.
The NISTP521 curve in short Weierstrass form.
The BrainpoolP256R1 curve in short Weierstrass form.
The BrainpoolP384R1 curve in short Weierstrass form.
The BrainpoolP512R1 curve in short Weierstrass form.
A short Weierstrass equivalent representation of Ed25519.
The Curve25519 curve in Montgomery form.
The Ed25519 curve in Edwards form.
X coordinate of the generator point of the ECC_NISTP256 curve.
Y coordinate of the generator point of the ECC_NISTP256 curve.
Prime of the generator point of the ECC_NISTP256 curve.
'a' constant of the ECC_NISTP256 curve when expressed in short Weierstrass form (y^2 = x^3 + a*x + b).
'b' constant of the ECC_NISTP256 curve when expressed in short Weierstrass form (y^2 = x^3 + a*x + b).
Order of the generator point of the ECC_NISTP256 curve.
'k' in Montgomery domain of the ECC_NISTP256 curve.
'a' in Montgomery domain of the ECC_NISTP256 curve.
'b' in Montgomery domain of the ECC_NISTP256 curve.
X coordinate of the generator point of the ECC_NISTP224 curve.
Y coordinate of the generator point of the ECC_NISTP224 curve.
Prime of the generator point of the ECC_NISTP224 curve.
'a' constant of the ECC_NISTP224 curve when expressed in short Weierstrass form (y^2 = x^3 + a*x + b).
'b' constant of the ECC_NISTP224 curve when expressed in short Weierstrass form (y^2 = x^3 + a*x + b).
Order of the generator point of the ECC_NISTP224 curve.
'k' in Montgomery domain of the ECC_NISTP224 curve.
'a' in Montgomery domain of the ECC_NISTP224 curve.
'b' in Montgomery domain of the ECC_NISTP224 curve.
X coordinate of the generator point of the ECC_Curve25519 curve.
Y coordinate of the generator point of the ECC_Curve25519 curve.
Prime of the generator point of the ECC_Curve25519 curve.
'a' constant of the ECC_Curve25519 curve when expressed in short Weierstrass form (y^2 = x^3 + a*x + b).
'b' constant of the ECC_Curve25519 curve when expressed in short Weierstrass form (y^2 = x^3 + a*x + b).
Order of the generator point of the ECC_Curve25519 curve.
Formats a CryptoKey to conform to Curve25519 private key requirements.

detaileddescription.para: Curve25519 has specific private key requirements specified by the curve definition. Specifically, the bottom three and the top bit may not be set and the second to last bit must be set.

parameterdescription.para: An initialized CryptoKey describing the entropy for a Curve25519 private key. Platform-specific restrictions for the location of the keying material apply. Some implementations do not support modifying keying material in flash for example.

simplesect.para: Initialize the CryptoKey with a 32-byte buffer in a compliant location.

briefdescription.para: Extracts the curve generator point from an ecliptic curve description.

detaileddescription.para: The curve parameters ECCParams_CurveParams::generatorX and ECCParams_CurveParams::generatorY are extracted from curveParams and written as a concatenated octet string in big endian order to buffer. The format is defined in SEC 1: Elliptic Curve Cryptography section 2.3.3.

The curve point has the format 0x04 || X || Y and the length is 2 * size_of_x_or_y + 1 where 0x04 specifies octet string format. If the buffer length exceeds the curve point length, the remaining buffer space is zeroed.

parameterdescription.para: Points to the input curve parameters
Points to the destination where the generator point will be written to. Make sure that buffer is large enough to hold
Maximum length of buffer in bytes.
on success, ECCParams_STATUS_ERROR if the provided buffer length is insufficient to hold the curve point.

detaileddescription.para: This file contains a common definition for elliptic curve structures used throughout the ECC based drivers. Not all devices support every curve.
